title: krb5: double-free in read_data() after realloc() fail

profile.name: curl
profile.about: cURL is an Open Source project providing a library and command-line tool for doing internet transfers

activities.message: Seems accurate, but very hard to actually exploit...
This piece of code is only used for krb5 auth over FTP (via `CURLOPT_KRBLEVEL`). Very rarely used...
Agree, it might not be widespread, but if a server/client sends the wrong len value, it will directly repro the double-free. The patch is ok.

additional_data.old_title: krb5: Potential double-free situation in read_data()
additional_data.new_title: krb5: double-free in read_data() after realloc() fail

activities.message: Verified. Advisory draft coming right up. I'd like to get this fixed and announced in sync with the 7.66.0 release on Sep 11!
Here's my first attempt at describing this flaw!
Only modified slightly a sentence, since I reproduced the `realloc()` failure with UINT32_MAX on a 64bit machine with more than 40GB of RAM. Feel free to re-edit it if needed. Thanks a lot.
I think I saw it failing because the kernel is a 2.6.32, since it is a server distro from 2017. Anyway, I agree with you, with current hardware/software, it will most probably not fail.
Thanks for your work. We've decided to reward you 200 USD for this finding.
Thanks a lot, again, much appreciated.
